intro: Cryptandra triplex, commonly known as the three-leaved cryptandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in heathland and scrub habitats. It is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, with multiple stems and a compact growth form. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
